recommendations.title: Regular Exercise
recommendations.description: Engage in regular physical activity such as brisk walking, swimming, or dancing for at least 30 minutes most days of the week.
recommendations.details: Exercise improves blood flow to the brain, reduces the risk of chronic diseases, and promotes overall brain health.

recommendations.title: Strength Training
recommendations.description: Incorporate strength training exercises using resistance bands or weights to maintain muscle mass and strength.
recommendations.details: Strength training helps support balance and coordination, which can reduce the risk of falls and cognitive decline.

recommendations.title: Yoga and Tai Chi
recommendations.description: Practice yoga or tai chi to improve flexibility, balance, and mental relaxation.
recommendations.details: Yoga and tai chi incorporate gentle movements, deep breathing, and meditation, which can reduce stress and improve cognitive function.

recommendations.title: Mediterranean Diet
recommendations.description: Follow a Mediterranean-style diet rich in fruits, vegetables, whole grains, fish, nuts, and olive oil.
recommendations.details: The Mediterranean diet is associated with a lower risk of cognitive decline and may help protect against Alzheimer's disease.

recommendations.title: Antioxidant-Rich Foods
recommendations.description: Include foods high in antioxidants such as berries, leafy greens, nuts, and seeds to reduce oxidative stress and inflammation in the brain.
recommendations.details: Antioxidants help protect brain cells from damage caused by free radicals and may help preserve cognitive function.

recommendations.title: Omega-3 Fatty Acids
recommendations.description: Incorporate omega-3 rich foods such as fatty fish (salmon, mackerel), flaxseeds, and walnuts into your diet.
recommendations.details: Omega-3 fatty acids support brain health, reduce inflammation, and may lower the risk of dementia.

recommendations.title: Brain Games and Puzzles
recommendations.description: Challenge your brain with puzzles, crosswords, Sudoku, or other cognitive games to keep your mind sharp.
recommendations.details: Regular mental stimulation promotes neural plasticity and strengthens brain connections, which can delay cognitive decline.

recommendations.title: Learn Something New
recommendations.description: Take up a new hobby, learn a new language, or enroll in classes to stimulate your brain and build cognitive reserves.
recommendations.details: Learning new skills or knowledge stimulates brain activity and enhances cognitive function, reducing the risk of dementia.

recommendations.title: Mindfulness Meditation
recommendations.description: Practice mindfulness meditation to reduce stress, improve focus, and enhance emotional well-being.
recommendations.details: Mindfulness meditation involves paying attention to the present moment without judgment, which can improve cognitive function and brain health.

recommendations.title: Stay Connected
recommendations.description: Maintain social connections with friends, family, and community groups to prevent social isolation and loneliness.
recommendations.details: Regular social interaction promotes emotional well-being, reduces stress, and may lower the risk of cognitive decline.

recommendations.title: Volunteer or Join Clubs
recommendations.description: Participate in volunteer activities or join clubs and organizations to stay engaged with others and contribute to your community.
recommendations.details: Volunteering and community involvement provide opportunities for social interaction, purpose, and fulfillment, which are beneficial for brain health.

recommendations.title: Pet Therapy
recommendations.description: Interact with animals through pet therapy programs or by owning a pet to reduce stress, anxiety, and depression.
recommendations.details: Spending time with animals can improve mood, increase socialization, and enhance overall well-being, which can benefit brain health.
